title: Husban dies leaves no will. A few years later wife dies leaves no will. There are no childern.
question: Who is the heirs.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Wills and estates,Estates,Taxes and estate planning,Wills,Probate,Intestacy and probate,Tax law
answers:
I just want to add the following to the discussion.

Because the decedent died without a surviving spouse or issue, there are special rules to determine the heirs of the share of property received from the decedent's predeceased spouse. For real property that the decedent received from her husband, these rules are applicable if the husband died within 15 years of the wife. For personal property, they are relevant if the deaths were within 5 years.

On each side since there are not any issue, you will first look to parents and issue of parents (siblings, nieces and nephews, etc), then to grandparents and the issue of grandparents (aunts, uncles, then cousins, etc), and finally to next of kin.

You do need to talk with a lawyer.

When a person dies without a will, the laws of intestate succession control the disposition of the estate. I am not a CA attorney, but any good CA estates attorney can help you with this information. You need to retain an attorney to assist you in determining where the assets go and in the administration of the estate or estates.

Next of Kin. If no relative can be located the property of the decedents will go the the State. Perhaps these folks had some brothers or sisters that can be located to determine who all of the relatives are and their particular degree of kinship.

A probate attorney can help you with this situation.

Are any of the decedent's parents living? If so, the property may revert back to the decedent's parents or the decedent's siblings. You really should consult with an Attorney to prevent things from just coming to a stand still.
